subject: Re: getting TestRunner to see junit.samples.AllTests
msgSnippet: Thanks. Yes and No,  it wasn t that simple - I d tried it without - but the answer is pretty darn simple. The final result that worked is
messageBody:
Thanks. Yes and No, it wasn't that simple - I'd tried it without -
but the answer is pretty darn simple.

The final result that worked is
JUNIT_HOME=C:\J2SDK_Forte
CLASSPATH=.;%JUNIT_HOME%\jnit3.7\junit.jar;%JUNIT_HOME\junit3.7;

which is equivalent to
CLASSPATH=.;C:\J2SDK_Forte\jnit3.7\junit.jar;C:\J2SDK_Forte\junit3.7;

which I'd tried before but it didn't work - I thought.

What I discovered is that I had to drop out of the DOS window after
each change of the environment. I'd make a change in the environment
to CLASSPATH but stay in the DOS same DOS window so it never saw the
change.

Thanks for thinking about this. Clif






--- In junit@y..., Mats Nyberg <mn@t...> wrote:
> i have the same set up but for the trailing slash on the end of
> %JUNIT_home% that works
> it just can't be that simple, can it
>
> cvedwards2 wrote:
>
> >Hi: Just downloaded JUnit; can't wait to use it but....
> >
> >I can get TestRunner to work ( using the awtui interface ) BUT it
> >throws 'Class not found junit.samples.AllTests"' - like others in this
> >group.
> >
> >I realize the AllTests class isn't in the jar. And I've tried LOTS of
> >CLASSPATHS. Here my best guess - that doesn't work:
> >
> >The wndows 2k directories are
> >C:
> > J2SDK_Forte
> > junit3.7
> > junit
> > samples
> > tests
> >
> >the Win2k User Environment variables are:
> >JUNIT_HOME=C:\J2SDK_Forte\junit3.7
> >CLASSPATH=.;%JUNIT_HOME%\junit.jar;%JUNIT_HOME%\; etc
> >
> >Test Runner works but fails to find the AllTests.class which I can see
> >in the samples dir.
> >
> >I've spent a lot of time on this. Hope someone can point out my error.
> >Thanks, Clif
> >
> >
